headline: Facebook is a social network monopoly that buys, copies or kills competitors, antitrust committee finds
summary: The House Judiciary antitrust subcommittee determined Facebook wields monopoly powers in social network and has maintained its position by acquiring, copying or killing its competitors, according to a report released by the subcommittee on Tuesday.
Rick Bright, the Trump administration vaccine expert turned whistleblower, resigned from the federal government Tuesday, according to a press release from his lawyer.
headline: Rick Bright, Trump administration vaccine expert turned whistleblower, resigns NIH post

summary: The 450-page report from the Democratic majority staff of the House Judiciary Committee focuses on Apple's control of its App Store, the only way for consumers to install apps or software on an iPhone, along with Apple's proclivity to buy smaller technology companies and turn them into features for Apple products.
headline: Apple's 'monopoly power' over iPhone app distribution gives it outsized profits, Democrats say

summary: Stocks fell on Tuesday after President Trump tweeted the White House would halt talks with Democrats about a second coronavirus stimulus deal.
headline: Stocks set to fall a second day after Trump halts stimulus talks, Dow futures fall 130 points

summary: "It's going to be a much slower recovery and it's disappointing that we didn't get a package done," Mester told CNBC.
headline: Trump's ending of stimulus talks will mean a 'much slower' recovery, Fed's Mester says
HHS threatens to withhold federal funding from hospitals that fail to report coronavirus data
Rock legend Eddie Van Halen has died after long battle with throat cancer
summary: Eddie Van Halen, guitarist and co-founder of Van Halen, has died after a long battle with throat cancer. He was 65.
TikTok has surpassed Instagram as teenagers' second favorite social media app, according to a report published on Tuesday.
headline: TikTok passes Instagram as second-most popular social app for U.S. teens
Boeing, airline stocks tumble after Trump calls off pandemic stimulus talks until after election
summary: Aviation-related stocks tumbled after Trump called off stimulus talks until after the Nov. 3 election.

headline: Canadian Oil and Gas Execs on the Midstream View
Facebook revenue chief says ad-supported model is ‘under assault’ amid Apple privacy changes
summary: The change to Apple's identifier for advertisers, or IDFA,will give iPhone users the option to block tracking when opening an app. Facebook calls it a threat to the ad-supported business model that's helped the internet grow.

headline: Supreme Court opens politically charged term with major business cases involving Google, Oracle and Ford
summary: Google, Oracle and Ford are at the Supreme Court in disputes expected to have broad impacts on American businesses and consumers.

headline: Watch live: Fauci, Slaoui, Bloomberg and Collins participate in coronavirus vaccine symposium
summary: Johns Hopkins University and the University of Washington are holding a series of panels on Tuesday with the nation's top health officials as part of a Covid-19 vaccine symposium.

headline: Apple announces Oct. 13 event where it's expected to reveal new iPhones
summary: Apple announced the new Apple Watch Series 6, iPad Air and 8th-generation iPad during an event in September but the iPhone was absent.

Most voters do not believe the U.S. will quickly rebound from the recession caused by the effects of coronavirus pandemic. About 65% of registered voters expect the U.S. economy to take more than a year to fully recover.
headline: 65% of voters believe it will take over a year for the economy to recover
Facebook, Twitter take down Trump post that falsely claims coronavirus is less deadly than flu
summary: "We remove incorrect information about the severity of Cobid-19, and have now removed this post," a Facebook spokesperson said in a statement to CNBC.
The subcommittee is seeking documents and information from the FDA and CDC on agency actions, drafts submitted to the White House and changes made during the review process.
headline: House panel investigates political interference by White House over coronavirus at CDC and FDA
Boeing slashes forecast for new aircraft demand, expects coronavirus pandemic to hurt sales for more than a decade
summary: Boeing slashed its 10-year forecast for new aircraft demand by 11% from a year ago, citing the impact of Covid-19.

The U.S. presidential debate and President Trump's positive Covid diagnosis sent reverberations across the stock market in the past week. Invesco's top strategist says investors should brace for even more volatility this month.
headline: Markets may be downplaying the chance of a contested election, says Invesco’s Kristina Hooper
Key GOP lawmaker lays out 'non-starters' for Big Tech antitrust reform
summary: The divergence leaves an opening for the powerful tech companies to oppose legislation that could install greater regulatory burdens.
